name: Lucile Batut
introduction: Wearing the double hat of finance and sustainability, I support finance departments in their transformation towards sustainability. With a management degree from a top business school in France, I have a multi-faceted experience from complementary positions I have held in business finance: from auditor to consolidation accountant, project manager, management controller and finance director. In addition to my background in financial business partnering, I am passionate about enabling change in companies, always looking after my teams and colleagues to create the conditions for collective success.
top_3_advice: Open your chakras: meet people, dare to trust, listen to side issues - even if you think they are not your core focus, you may be pleasantly surprised.
Take action: baby steps, testing and learning are the best way to move forward and refine your vision.
Connect with nature: it is a tremendous source of energy and will help you refocus when you feel overwhelmed.
how_can_help: I am happy to share my knowledge and experience in business finance, educational design, team engagement and cross-functional alignment. As a member of the coordination team, I have a good overview of all of The Matcha Initiative's activities and ecosystem. I am also good at bringing people together and connecting the dots.
sustainability_journey: As a French person who lived in Asia for 7 years, I saw the recent disruptions of our world as another warning sign that I could no longer ignore. At the same time, I felt that my professional career needed a deeper purpose. I started my journey with the Climate Fresk, first as a participant. It was here that I realised I had my own role to play: spreading the word, educating, harnessing collective intelligence, encouraging people to focus on solutions. So I became a Climate Fresk facilitator.
tmi_role: Part of the working group for the Sustainability Accounting and Sustainable Finance category. Used broad experience of finance ecosystem to define practical methodologies and speak CFO language. Responsible for organising masterclasses, managing events and coordinating content with trainers.
education_credentials: Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership 8-week course 'Business and climate change: towards net zero emissions' (2023)
Carbon footprint assessment training with Carbone 4 Academy
Management degree from top business school in France
challenges_overcome: First challenge was dealing with overwhelming breadth of sustainability. Decided to focus on carbon management vertical. Second challenge was discussing with sustainability experts - overcame by bringing own lenses and hands-on experience with 'ordinary people' not familiar with sustainability, keeping language simple and accessible.
most_proud_of: Volunteering for TMI made me step out of my comfort zone and try new things. I am proud of breaking down barriers and building bridges: between Europe and Asia; between finance and sustainability; between business and NGOs; between people and nature. It all resonates with one of my core values: Harmony.
tmi_coordination_team: Member with good overview of all activities and ecosystem
core_value: Harmony - building bridges between different domains and regions
asia_experience: 7 years living in Asia as French person
